website_summaries.verdict: Affordable two-way coaxial speaker that offers the same acoustic punch as more expensive, higher premium options.
pros: The 6.5-inch profile is the perfect size to fit in a wide variety of vehicles without the need for additional modification
Will work with many different factory-built and aftermarket stereo systems
cons: Uses lower quality parts to lower the price tag

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for the price. I have always used Kenwood speakers in the past and was not surprised to find the same sound quality with these! They are a great way to improve the audio quality of the stock components in your car!
customer_reviews.author: M.A.P.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality - Good Sound - Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: These worked great replacing the original speakers in my wife's '93 Honda Civic. Her car door panels didn't need the speaker grilles that comes with these. Rather than trying to buy some kind of fancy connector to mate up with the original harness connector, I just cut the connector off the original harness and spliced the wires together with a couple small twist on electrical wire nuts. If they're good enough for high voltage connections, they're good enough for 12 volts. The job was easy, directions were good and came with extra hardware for different mounting applications. I reused the original speaker screws that held the old speakers in the doors. Good quality sound for her stock stereo system.
customer_reviews.author: Tj4fa

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat the sound. Had to replace my blown stock front speakers on my 2006 chevy colorado. You will have to drill 4 new holes for each speaker to mount them but took less than 1 hour. You'll also have to splice in new speaker connectors (supplied) unless you get the GM adapters which coat less than $10.
customer_reviews.author: Ran-D

customer_reviews.title: 2000-2006 Suburban Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a 2000-2006 Suburban without the Bose system. They worked great. The rear doors installed with the original screws for the factory speakers. The front doors installed without any aftermarket plastic insert. All I did was use 4 drywall track screws to install them with my battery drill. I did use the Metra 72-4568 to connect to the factory wiring. They sounded great with my stock radio. Two of my stock ones did not work and the other two were blown. They are not the best speakers, but they improved the sound 100% or back to what it sounded like 140,000 miles ago. Mine is a 2000 model.
customer_reviews.author: Conn88

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. I am not impressed with the overall sound quality of these or their 6 x 9 versions. They are a big improvement over the factory speakers and will work for now. I will be replacing them soon with NVX or Hertz series speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice for 2003 Outback stock replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent replacement for stock front door speaker in 2003 Subaru Outback. Didn't need a cable either - spade lugs are the same so - just used a T15 Torx to dismount the bad speaker from its mount and swapped the new speaker in - moving the stock cable connections over. Have perfect holes in the right place to mount. Sound seems identical in tone and efficiency to the stock unit. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Carl R. Downey

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why these were rated so high
customer_reviews.text: Replaced old Pioneers with these and regretted it immediately. I get a slight buzzing from these that wasn't there before and they're not very powerful
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding for the money
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound for the price. While these won't rattle you with deep bass they are crisp and clear with good range. I have installed these in a custom box I made out of some spare wood and some low cost Lepy and OneU amp. I haven't decided which to use but both drive these speakers well with the Lepy just edging things out with more loudness. Either way you can't beat the price and Kenwood quality here.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: They sound great for where I have them mounted I wanted music in my shed so I hooked up a small car stereo in my shed and wired these into it for tunes while I work!! Good purchase and they work GREAT as I said!!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: No low notes AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers to replace my factory speakers when i bought a subwoofer. These speakers will distort at ANY level of bass. If you like to hear even the slightest bit of bass coming from the side speakers themselves, these are not for you. Even paired with a subwoofer that hits most of the low notes, they cant handle anything that isnt treble. They are the exact same sound quality as my factory speakers were so I would only recommend these if you need a replacement. Dont expect it to sound like an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: bob johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect OEM replacement.
customer_reviews.text: These are an awesome Kenwood product for entry level. If all you want to do is replace those junk speakers that are stock in the majority of automobiles without breaking the bank, these are for you.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Brownlee

customer_reviews.title: Sounds much better than stock speakers and you can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these Kenwoods to replace the blown front China garbage GM speakers in my 2012 Malibu. My driver side speaker would work fine on day and then not work at all the next day. The install was a somewhat involved due to having to take off the door panels and then I had to modify the old speaker baskets to affix the Kenwoods. Overall, With the stock head unit, these speakers sound better then the stock ones and I really am satisfied with the sound and the low cost that these speakers provide.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bargain speakers for a compromise
customer_reviews.text: It's really hard to criticize a speaker when it is this cheap and is an improvement over a factory speaker. That said, I found in my installation (2004 Honda Pilot, rear doors) the low end completely disappeared. The mids and highs were improved though. The description for this speaker states mid-bass and mid-range improvement. I found that to be true. So it was a trade off for me. Gain mids and highs at the expense of lows.
customer_reviews.author: The Nannerpus

customer_reviews.title: What a deal
customer_reviews.text: Sound so much better than my stock speakers. I wasn't expecting them to sound this good at the low price I paid. UPDATE 8/9/15 I just installed an 12 subwoofer in my car and I have these 6.5's in my front door panels. The quality of sound these things delivery is awesome considered price tag. They are perfect for pure rich high's in an entry level system. I thinking of buying 2 more for the back deck. If I don't buy these I will be because I bought some kenwood components
customer_reviews.author: Steven Wason

customer_reviews.title: speakers are as good as the stock car speakers on my BMW
customer_reviews.text: speakers are okay, would have went with some Pioneers 3 ways. However for the price cant really complain. i'm running a 900 watt 4 channel amp with these speakers. speakers are as good as the stock car speakers on my BMW, however i have highs now with the tweeters.
customer_reviews.author: MasterB

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, sound quality and great services from Amazon, I give it 5 stars. The frequency respond was so much better than my 2001 Odyssey front OEM speakers, also sensitivity same as the OEM, wish I was order this sooner since my original speakers surround foam was cracked and cause sound distortion, the installation was easy with the include wires and connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Very nice highs, and the sound is crisp
customer_reviews.text: Very nice highs, and the sound is crisp. However, mids and lows are seriously nonexistant. They might sound okay in a larger component system, but on their own they do not get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Moenart

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Good speakers at an affordable price. They have a certain rich clarity that is 10X better than the stock speakers that I replaced. But kind of disappointed these don't blow me away.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: Ummm lol very low quality compared to the Skar Rpxs I bough that are 5.25s but way louder & way better quality for a little bit more money. Kenwood needs to step it up to stay in this business
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding replacement speakers. Price is good too. I installed these in the front doors of my '07 Silverado then decided to try the 3-ways(KFC-1664s) in the back doors...big difference between the two. These sound SO much better than the 3-ways and have tons more bass(as much as can be expected out of a 6.5 in).
customer_reviews.author: JLass

customer_reviews.title: Nice and loud
customer_reviews.text: Alot better than the stock speakers in my silverado 3500 dually
customer_reviews.author: josh Wells

customer_reviews.title: Nice speakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a replacement to my Diamond Audio speakers that blew after years of punishment, I'm selling the car soon so didn't want to get high end speakers. These wired up with some bass blockers produces some nice sound. I have subwoofers so didn't need these to pump out bass - allows me to crank up without them distorting. Great for the price would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: nnorton44

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality for the price! Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good for a average person.
customer_reviews.text: They work like a charm, in my infinti g35 sedan, I got two in the front doors and they have good bass but not so much where you will disrupt other outside but in the car really nice, might get me another pair for the back doors, but easy install if you know how to work with wires, good price.
customer_reviews.author: Keanu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set of speakers
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disgruntled, at first, the speakers were a little too small for my specific car but i finally got everything set up, i replaced my front 2 speakers and they made a very noticeable improvement the bass in the speakers is pretty powerful my entire car vibrates when I've got the bass on a medium-high level, so basically I recommend these speakers and am now a fan of kenwood.
customer_reviews.author: Tas saT

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker when you're trying to replace Factory speakers in ...
customer_reviews.text: Great speaker when you're trying to replace Factory speakers in your car. They are very efficient so they sound great without a high-powered amplifier. There are probably other speakers that sound a little better but these are hard to beat for the price and the ability to function with the factory sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Maus

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive speaker.
customer_reviews.text: Installed to 2008 Honda Element with 7 speaker stock. No issues with depth in front doors. Sounds great on older vehicle - better than old stock. Purchased additional wiring harness.
customer_reviews.author: TheMirrorImage

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Speakers!
customer_reviews.text: I put these into my 68 Mustang Bullitt. They sound awesome cruising down the road. Definitely are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: donald

customer_reviews.title: that good. The sound a little better than my trucks ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, there cheap, that good. The sound a little better than my trucks stock speakers and I just needed cheap replacements. They are a bit hissy I guess. The low range is pretty week. But they work as a OEM replacement.
customer_reviews.author: SS6

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic speaker
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic speaker. Once the speaker is installed it takes a couple weeks for the speaker to become full quality. Sound output is fantastic on the stock radio.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Milem

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding speakers and a rock bottom price, very happy
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound on these. I replaced the blown factory speakers in my 2007 Kia Sportage and managed to install these in under an hour. I'm very happy with the results. Sound is clear with good bass response and the high wattage insures the head unit won't be blowing these out anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Merchantprince

customer_reviews.title: Great little speakers on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to replace the front speakers on my 1995 F-250 XLT with Extended Cab. Worked great - wasn't looking for huge sound, just something to replace the blown out old ones on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: jman251

customer_reviews.title: I have always love Kenwood. Bought these while upgrading stock system in ...
customer_reviews.text: I have always love Kenwood. Bought these while upgrading stock system in 08 Jeep Wrangler. If your just using these to replace stock speakers though i would recommend installing a 4 channel amp, otherwise the speakers sound a bit flat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For around $25 you cant expect anything amazing, but these speakers are very good for their ...
customer_reviews.text: For around $25 you cant expect anything amazing, but these speakers are very good for their price. I got mine to replace my 15 year old stock car speakers with blown tweeters, and have had no problems with them for the first couple of months so far. As far as the overall quality, they really lack bass, but have an acceptable enough amount for anybody isnt buying speakers specifically for the sound quality, but i got these to go with a subwoofer so lack of bass isnt a problem for me. All in all, these are decent speakers for a great price and make an excellent budget replacement or upgrade for stock speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Jared E

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 1 week of jamming an mid-range volume level with Kenwood built-in EQ Driver. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: nets

customer_reviews.title: Sounds So Sweet!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got around to having these installed in my 04 Dodge Dakota Pickup because when I bought the Truck the factory speakers were blown on the drivers side! And these on the factory cd player sound AWESOME!! I recommend these for anyone that wants a great sound for less money!!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bob

customer_reviews.title: These are good replacement speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are good replacement speakers. Definately not an upgrade of any kind. Mediocre sound. But the price is cheap, so cant really complain. Sounds like something from the walmart auto isle. But once again they are cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good and Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat these! They provide plenty of volume and response is way better than their price warrants. Obviously you won't get any thumping bass from these, but if that's what you're expecting in this price point you're going to be in for a surprise. This is my third set and I will continue to buy them in the future for any other cars that need new speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Furnas

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement speakers
customer_reviews.text: A great replacement for some OEM speakers in our RV. Fit perfect and was able to use existing grill covers. Sound quality was good, but not great for bass. Magnets much lighter weight than on original OEM speakers. Overall, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: moreynj

customer_reviews.title: Great price for the sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Can't beat the sound for what you pay for these. Doesn't do so well on the lows but if you divert all you bass to a subwoofer, like I do, that won't be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Latanzi

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: were good sounding. did not last long. Dead in a year, no amp, just a plain aftermarket radio.
customer_reviews.author: salvatore raber

customer_reviews.title: Great product and work flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I installed these to my 2007 honda civic si. Some cars may need an adaptor like my honda. But they include some clips to help attach them to the doors. They also sound great better than the pre-installed speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Marley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good, cheap speakers with good clear sound quality, especially for the price range.
customer_reviews.author: To Be Continued

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on 99 civic LX. Drastically improved sound quality over factory speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Goedecke

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: already clipping with heavy bass, definitely would not handle 300 watts
customer_reviews.author: Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers for the price. Liked the sound so much I purchased another pair to replace the rear speakers in my car.
customer_reviews.author: david brackin

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: For $20 its better than nothing. If your looking for speakers that sound amazing with the radio cranked up these arent it. But they arent the worst things ive heard.
customer_reviews.author: jenifer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 5 Stars All The Way! Product As Described Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Greg J.

customer_reviews.title: Good Budget Replacement
customer_reviews.text: The magnets were less than half the size of the stock Panasonic speakers, but they sound fine and the price was right. After installation, I didn't change the balance at all, so sound output seems about the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jimi

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive speaker
customer_reviews.text: Used these in my car that needed new speakers. These are a great value and have good sound quality. I would have no trouble buying these again, so if you're on the fence, don't worry. Buy them!
customer_reviews.author: TKALA

customer_reviews.title: Great price and shipping speed
customer_reviews.text: Great price and shipping speed. Purchased two sets. Found a Lowes receipt in one box and mounting screws/clips were missing. I made it work since I have all that stuff in my garage any ways. Sounds better than stock civic speakers.
customer_reviews.author: hahano404

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing the speakers in my truck. These were easy to install and sound great.
customer_reviews.author: heather m hawk

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: After installing instantly had a rattle in one of the speakers. Cheaply made and no longevity of product.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good!
customer_reviews.text: If you own an EK generation civic, 96-00 I can confirm these fit directly into the front door without any cutting, modifications, etc. Thank you Kenwood. Sounds good!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers. Fit perfectly in my 2006 GMC Sierra
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers. Fit perfectly in my 2006 GMC Sierra. I had to modify how the front door speakers installed but that is a manufacturers issue and the mod was not difficult at all. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie/Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Very good speakers for my work truck
customer_reviews.text: Twenty bucks? What, are you kidding me? Very good speakers for my work truck, and easy to install....and they look good.
customer_reviews.author: Sean D. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Not much of an upgrade over factory speakers.
customer_reviews.text: MEh. Tried to upgrade my Wife's CRV speakers. Although they supposed fit, You have to make brackets for them. And the sound is really not much of an upgrade over factory speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok if the system has something else to deliver lows.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality for mids and highs is good. They deliver a disappointingly small amount of low frequencies. VW's non-premium paper cone component speakers deliver better lows even at 14 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price these are 5 stars for sound and fit in a 2002 Impreza with after market Pioneer head unit. Bass is limited but with some EQ sounds good at high volumes. Very slim speaker and Installed in front doors with no issues clearing the glass.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice affordable speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Even though these are cheap, they're a million times better than stock. They didn't fit directly into my 2001 Nissan Maxima, so I had to get adapters. But they sound great and were easy to hook up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blair

customer_reviews.title: They are ok,  not a great set of speakers but good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best speakers you can buy, but they are cheap, if you're buying these expecting audiophile sound, you will be sorely mistaken, but they are OK and sound good enough for my needs, so who can complain.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for decent sound
customer_reviews.text: Fit the old housing for rear door speakers on 04 Envoy perfectly. All I had to do was remove the mount for stock speaker and screwed the new Kenwoods in. Sounds just fine
customer_reviews.author: san diego

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade for my 2003 Honda CRV front doors
customer_reviews.text: Excellent upgrade for my 2003 Honda CRV front doors. It did take some homemade plywood spacer rings to make it work in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: It's All About the Bass
customer_reviews.text: Some would probably like these better than I. Fine product, but very deep bass tones' I have to really tweak the mids and highs to get a balanced sound.
customer_reviews.author: JClouseau

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable sound for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Fit the front door brackets perfectly for my 1997 Honda Accord EX. I had previously ordered some other 6.5'' speakers which didn't fit. These sound fine - nothing special but functional.
customer_reviews.author: mrharmon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price. For the exact same thing
customer_reviews.text: Awesome price. For the exact same thing, Crutchfield is $40.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Broussard

customer_reviews.title: A great factory replacement.
customer_reviews.text: These little guys work great for a factory replacement speaker if you are dealing with an old/blown speaker. They don't have much low end but that should be expected out of a cheaper two way speaker. Hooked up to an aftermarket radio they were easy to push to distortion and were quickly replaced. But if you are only dealing with the 10w that most factory stereos provide these make a great low price alternative that will provide decent, clear sound.
customer_reviews.author: Goat Rope Garage

customer_reviews.title: Good value, works great as replacement for stock door ...
customer_reviews.text: Good value, works great as replacement for stock door speakers in a 2007 Cobalt that is notorious for OEM speakers going bad. Installed with baffles (bought separately) to add protection.
customer_reviews.author: jz

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: With the low price I was sure these wouldn't be too good. I was wrong! These speakers are great!
customer_reviews.author: virginia

customer_reviews.title: there are better speakers
customer_reviews.text: not great- put them in my 2001 GMC Sierra- glad i got the pair for $20 spend the extra for a set of infinity kappas- I did in the end
customer_reviews.author: NotPaidToReview

customer_reviews.title: everything sounds great.
customer_reviews.text: Used these to replace my stock front speakers, high passed them just a tad and put the stock speakers in the rear to handle most of the mids (stock speakers are 1 way). Complete with a 12" kenwood sub, I can't complain, everything sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent speakers for the price. Used as an upgrade to factory speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Price for Performance
customer_reviews.text: Running off a pioneer headunit with MDF speaker ring mount sounds a little bass'y compared to my old pioneer 6.5 , Matches really well with the headunits power though
customer_reviews.author: Khalifa

customer_reviews.title: High's don't sound that crisp.
customer_reviews.text: The highs don't sound as crisp as the Pyle 6x9's I installed in the front of my truck at the same time. A little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: N. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: They are not terrible for the price so almost could rate it a 4. Just expected it to be a little better.
customer_reviews.author: AyeOutThere

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and sound good with my pioneer.
customer_reviews.text: These are great cheap speakers, play loud and clear.. cannot complain
customer_reviews.author: Jaxsey X. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stock replacement speaker at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Great low powered speaker. Perfect for stock radio's and typical aftermarket headunits. Fit my 2000 Buick Lesabre without an issue and sound like they should.
customer_reviews.author: N. Mollring

customer_reviews.title: Big upgrade over stock.
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement over stock. Used a higher power head unit (45w rms) and pushes these great. Somewhat tinny but is to be expected since tweeter wasn't silk. Stock speakers were from 94 accord, but some branded ford? It was a used car lol
customer_reviews.author: D. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Okay speakers...don't expect to be blown away
customer_reviews.text: THE GOOD / Affordable THE BAD / Sound quality won't blow you away. THE BOTTOM LINE / When properly tuned the KFC-1665S speakers can provide adequate sound. I used mine with the Kenwood DNX571HD which has a 7 band graphic equalizer. The low frequency response is adequate but if you require some punchy bass you will need to get a separate subwoofer. The tweeter delivers smooth highs but lacks the sharp details. As with many speakers out there, the sound will distort when the speakers played too loud. They earn 3 stars because even though they are affordable and sound better than stock, both of them blew out in less than 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed.
customer_reviews.text: These were the perfect replacement for the OEM speakers in my Subaru. Easy to install and sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement speakers in my 20' travel trailer. Easy to install and sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Works with factory head unit.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers work right out of the box in my 2003 Mini Cooper S with the stock head unit and no amplifier. Great factory replacement if you know what you're doing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent speakers for general listening.
customer_reviews.text: Good speaker for the money, seems a bit muddy at anything over mid-volume.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ragsdale

customer_reviews.title: they sound perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought for around 20$. they sound perfect for the price. Great replacement for my old factory speakers. Perfect if you are on a budget or don't want to spend too much on audio equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Superb for the price. Replaced my 10 year old Civic speakers. Didn't need anything extraordinary.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves them
customer_reviews.text: They were a gift for my grandson for Christmas he loves them.
customer_reviews.author: shelia lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Rock the Casaba!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good speaker but does not have the bass I wanted but, it is hard to get bass out of anything other than a sub.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fix it myself!

customer_reviews.title: Work amazing
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install and sound great. Would highly recommend to anyone looking to buy speakers
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these speaker were amazing! I'm so impressed with these speakers, that I'm going to try the performance series next because i can only imagine how good they can be.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Simmons

customer_reviews.title: 300Watts is not the continuous output....
customer_reviews.text: It's actually my fault not Kenwoods, but I seen the price and seen 300 Watts not realizing its really like a 50 watts continuous speaker.... Anywho it still worked out although I altered my plans.... It's actually a very good sound. My gripe was my hastily purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like I said
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I installed them correctly. Next time I will let a professional install them. Sound a little muffled and with static at times. Like I said, it was probably my rookie mistake and therefore not getting the quality sound I was looking forward to.
customer_reviews.author: J. Armando Beltran

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are better than the factory speakers but seems like they are not quiet as loud.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Norfolk

customer_reviews.title: Great sound in a 2001 Jeep Cherokee Classic
customer_reviews.text: Fit great in a 2001 Cherokee Classic. The rears in the roof fit perfectly. Fit in frontdoors too, just had to drill holes for the mounting screws.
customer_reviews.author: addicted2chrome

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for the factory speakers in my car
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for the factory speakers in my car. You may need an adapter for mounting the speakers. Didnt match the holes in rear dash but i managed to make it work with some zip ties.
customer_reviews.author: J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Those little speakers pack a punch. The sound is very clear.
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: For the price you can't beat the sound quality, ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat the sound quality, I always throw a set with some 6x9s and these in every car or truck I have owned. Just don't turn your music up to 11 and they'll last for a long time (I've never had a failure, and mine are usually loud with the windows down all the time)
customer_reviews.author: Darrel

customer_reviews.title: It really is a 5 3/4 speaker, not a ...
customer_reviews.text: It really is a 5 3/4 speaker, not a 6.5. Tried to replace my stock 6.5 in a Jeep Grand Cherokee Laredo. Ended up returning due to the size issue. Theses are small.
customer_reviews.author: tylerwhofishes

customer_reviews.title: Sound great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Sound great for the price! Didn't fit my 3000gt but hey nothing does so I did a little rigging. I'd buy these again
customer_reviews.author: jenni p

customer_reviews.title: amazingly good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: amazingly good quality for the price. a pleasant surprise, I plan to pick up a set for my other vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Jakob Brown

customer_reviews.title: Just Ok....
customer_reviews.text: They seem to sound just like the stock speakers in my car that was built in 1999. I was hoping for a more noticable improvment.
customer_reviews.author: Fairly reliable Joe

product_meta.title: Kenwood KFC-1665S 300-Watt 6.5-Inch 2-Way Sport Series Flush Mount Coaxial Speakers with Paper Tweeters, Set of 2
product_meta.description: Style:KFC-1665SThe KFC-1665S 6-1/2" 2-way speakers feature polypropylene cones that will enrich your music with all the midbass and midrange details, while the 1" balanced-dome tweeters will make high notes soar. Kenwood also includes sharp-looking grilles in case you're doing a custom installation in your vehicle. Finally, you can enjoy your music the way it was meant to be heard, with clarity and emotion.
feature_bullets: 4" Sport Series 2-Way Flush Mount Car Speakers
Power Handling: Peak: 300 watts / RMS: 30 watts
